   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %%% Purpose : Test records.
   23: 
   24: -module(record_SUITE).
   25: 
   26: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   30: 	 init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   31: 	 errors/1,record_test/1,eval_once/1]).
   32: 
   33: -export([debug/0]).
   34: 
   35: suite() ->
   36:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   37:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     cases().
   41: 
   42: groups() -> 
   43:     [].
   44: 
   45: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: 
   52: cases() -> 
   53:     [errors, record_test, eval_once].
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   56:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   63:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   64:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, int:interpreted()),
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: -record(foo, {a,b,c,d}).
   71: -record(bar, {a,b,c,d}).
   72: -record(barf, {a,b,c,d,e}).
   73: 
   74: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   75:     Foo = #foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4},
   76:     #foo{a=19,b=42,c=3,d=4} = update_foo(Foo, 19, 42),
   77: 
   78:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19)),
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   81:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   82: 
   83:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19)),
   84:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35)),
   85:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   86:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   87:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19,
   88: 							   35, 17, 42, -2)),
   89: 
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: update_foo(#foo{}=R, A, B) ->
   93:     R#foo{a=A,b=B}.
   94: 
   95: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A) ->
   96:     R#bar{a=A}.
   97: 
   98: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
   99:     R#bar{a=A,b=A}.
  100: 
  101: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  102:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  103: 
  104: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  105:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  106: 
  107: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A) ->
  108:     R#barf{a=A}.
  109: 
  110: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  111:     R#barf{a=A,b=A}.
  112: 
  113: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  114:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  115: 
  116: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  117:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  118: 
  119: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D, E) ->
  120:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D,e=E}.
  121: 
  122: 
  123: -define(TrueGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ok; true -> ct:fail(failed) end).
  124: -define(FalseGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ct:fail(failed); true -> ok end).
  125: 
  126: record_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  128:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  129:     false = is_record({foo}, foo),
  130: 
  131:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  132:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  133:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo),
  134: 
  135:     false = is_record([], foo),
  136:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  137: 
  138:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  139:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  140:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo)),
  141: 
  142:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  143:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  144:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  145: 
  146:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo)),
  147:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo)),
  148: 
  149:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  150: 
  151:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  152:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  153:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo)),
  154: 
  155:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  156:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  157:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  158: 
  159:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  160:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo)),
  161:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf)),
  162: 
  163:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo)),
  164: 
  165:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo)),
  166:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo)),
  167: 
  168:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  169: 
  170:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  171:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  172:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  173: 
  174:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  175:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  176:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  177: 
  178:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  179:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  180: 
  181:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo)),
  182:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo)),
  183: 
  184:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  185: 
  186:     False = id(false),
  187:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo) xor False),
  188:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf) xor False),
  189:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo) xor False ),
  190: 
  191:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo) xor False),
  192:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf) xor False),
  193: 
  194: 
  195:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  196: 
  197:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  198: 
  199:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo)],
  200:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar)],
  201:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  202: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar)],
  203:     [1,3,5,7] =
  204: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar)) and (not is_record(X, foo)))],
  205:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  206: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (is_record(X, foo)))],
  207:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  208: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (X < 5))],
  209: 
  210:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  211:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo)],
  212:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo)],
  213:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo) end],
  214:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo) end],
  215:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or
  216: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  217:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  218: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  219:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  220:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  221: 			     is_reference(X)],
  222:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  223: 				   begin is_record(X, foo) or
  224: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  225:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  226: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  227: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  228:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  229: 			begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end],
  230:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  231: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  232: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  233: 
  234:     {_R, 2} = check_bindings(#foo{}, 4),
  235: 
  236:     [a,b,c,d] = record_info(fields, foo),
  237:     5 = record_info(size, foo),
  238:     Foo2 = id(#foo{a=v1, b=true, c=false, d=v4}),
  239:     2 = #foo.a,
  240:     #foo.a = 2,
  241:     5 = #foo.d,
  242:     #foo.d = 5,
  243:     v1 = Foo2#foo.a,
  244:     v4 = Foo2#foo.d,
  245: 
  246:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.a == baz),
  247:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.c),
  248:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.a),
  249: 
  250:     ?TrueGuard(Foo2#foo.b),
  251:     ?TrueGuard(Foo2#foo.d == v4),
  252: 
  253:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.d, Foo2) == baz),
  254:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.d, Foo2)),
  255:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.c, Foo2)),
  256: 
  257:     ?TrueGuard(element(#foo.a, Foo2) == v1),
  258:     ?TrueGuard(element(#foo.b, Foo2)),
  259:     ok.
  260: 
  261: check_bindings(R0, Int) ->
  262:     R = R0#foo{a=(X=Int div 2)},
  263:     {R, X}.
  264: 
  265: eval_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  267: 		 true = erlang:is_record(GetRec(), foo)
  268: 	 end, #foo{}),
  269:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  270: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1}
  271: 	 end, #foo{}),
  272:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  273: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2}
  274: 	 end, #foo{}),
  275:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  276: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3}
  277: 	 end, #foo{}),
  278:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  279: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  280: 	 end, #foo{}),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: once(Test, Record) ->
  284:     put(?MODULE, 0),
  285:     GetRec = fun() ->
  286: 		     put(?MODULE, 1+get(?MODULE)),
  287: 		     Record
  288: 	     end,
  289:     Result = Test(GetRec),
  290:     case get(?MODULE) of
  291: 	1 -> ok;
  292: 	N ->
  293: 	    io:format("Evaluated ~w times\n", [N]),
  294: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  295:     end,
  296:     Result.
  297: 
  298: id(I) ->
  299:     I.
  300: 
  301: debug() ->
  302:     %% Used for interactive debugger to see that step and next behaves
  303:     %% decent
  304:     _A00 = #foo{},
  305:     A0 = #foo{a=d1, c=d3},
  306:     A1  = A0#foo{a=1},
  307:     A2 = A1#foo{a=A1#foo.a+1, b=1, d=id(1)},
  308:     A2#foo{a=1,
  309:            b=2,
  310:            c=3}.
